org.kjots.json.content.shared
Interface JsonContentHandler

All Known Subinterfaces:
JsonContentChannel
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractJsonContentChannel, JsonObjectBuilder, JsonTextBuilder, JsonTextGenerator, JsonWriter, PartialJsonContentHandler
public interface JsonContentHandler

JSON Content Handler.

This interface defines a handler for JSON content, similar in nature to the SAX ContentHandler. The methods of this interface represent events that correspond to the content of a JSON data structure.

It is the responsibility of the consumer of this interface (i.e. the generator of JSON content events) to ensure that the methods of this interface are invoked consistently; that is, there is no requirement for an implementation of this interface to verify that a particular method is invoked in the correct context.

Created: 28th January 2010.

Since:
1.0
Author:
Karl J. Ots <kjots@kjots.org>

          Handle the end of the JSON content.

Method Detail

startJson

void startJson()
Handle the start of the JSON content.

Following the invocation of this method, the content handler will be in the root context.

endJson

void endJson()
Handle the end of the JSON content.

This method will only be invoked in the root context and will mark the closing of that context, and thus the end of the JSON content.

startObject

void startObject()
Handle the start of a JSON object.

Following the invocation of this method, the content handler will be in an object context.

endObject

void endObject()
Handle the end of a JSON object.

This method will only be invoked in an object context and will mark the closing of that object context.

startArray

void startArray()
Handle the start of a JSON array.

Following the invocation of this method, the content handler will be in an array context.

endArray

void endArray()
Handle the end of a JSON array.

This method will only be invoked in an array context and will mark the closing of that context.

memberName

void memberName(String name)
Handle the name of a member of a JSON object.

This method will only be invoked in an object context.

Parameters:
name - The name of the member.

primitive

void primitive(Object value)
Handle a JSON primitive.

The type of the given value parameter will be, depending on the type of the JSON primitive:

  • null
    • null
  • boolean
    • Boolean
  • number
    • Integer for integer values between -231 and 231-1 inclusive, or
    Long for all other integer values between -263 and 263-1 inclusive, or
    BigInteger for all other integer values, or
    BigDecimal for all non-integer values
  • string
    • String

This method will only be invoked in an object or an array context. In an object context, this method will be immediately preceded by an invocation of memberName(String).

Parameters:
value - The value of the JSON primitive.
